data.expected: BG x BG -> 1/4 BB, 1/2 BG, 1/4 GG
data.sampled:
Blue x Blue = 4/4 Blue
It is not possible to get 1/4 Green and 3/4 Blue.

Possible monohybrid cross between Blue and Blue. Offspring have a genotype of Bb.

Possible crosses for B x B are:

 BG x BG --> 1/4 BB, 2/4 BG, 1/4 GG
  B_ x B_ --> 1/4 BB, 1/2 B_, 1/4 GG
  BB x B_ --> 3/4 BB, 1/4 BG, 0/4 GG
  bB x bB --> 1/2 BB, 1/4 B_, 1/4 gg

If we are to get 3/4 Blue and 1/4 Green in the F2, this would suggest a cross of:

 B_ x B_.

However, their is no allele for G in this case, so I can't figure out a scenario for this.

If it is possible to get this distribution, let me know and I will look into it again.

Please confirm if my answer is correct.
